36:39PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.MSGSNDU_INTR_PRESENT_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:3) [0000]
40:43PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.MSGSNDU_INTR_REQUESTED_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:3) [0000]
44:47PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.INT_TCEQ_QME_XX_MSGSNDU_INTR_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:3) [0000]
48:51PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.TCEQ_XX_CTFS_MSB_DEC_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:3) [0000]
52:55PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.CTFS_DEC_REQUESTED_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:3) [0000]
56PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.XX_CTFS_MSB_HDEC_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
57PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.CTFS_HDEC_REQUESTED_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
58PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.XX_TCEQ_OTHER_DPDES_INTR_PENDING_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
59PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.DPDES_INTR_REQUESTED_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
60PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.XX_TCEQ_PC_INTR_PENDING_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
61PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.PC_INTR_REQUESTED_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
62PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.REG_WKUP_PRESENT_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
63PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.REG_WKUP_REQUESTED_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
Bit(s)PPESCOM Dial: Description
0:3 ROX ROX QME_CISR_HYP_INTR_PRESENT: Raw Value of the Hypervisor Virtualization Interrupt from the XIVE interrupt controller for Thread 0..3 of this Core before any gating.
4:7 ROX ROX QME_CISR_OS_INTR_PRESENT: Raw Value of the "OS" External Interrupt from the XIVE interrupt controller for Thread 0..3 of this Core before any gating.
8:11 ROX ROX QME_CISR_MSGSND_INTR_PRESENT: Sticky Value of the Hypervisor Doorbell Interrupt from the XIVE interrupt controller for Thread 0..3 of this Core, cleared when acknowledged by the
Core.
12:15 ROX ROX QME_CISR_EBB_INTR_PRESENT: Value of the Event Based Branch Interrupt from the XIVE interrupt controller for Thread 0..3 of this Core.
Note this is not a Wakeup Source (info only)
16:19 ROX ROX QME_CISR_HYP_INTR_REQUESTED: Hypervisor Virtualization Interrupt for Thread 0..3 is a requested wakeup source for this Core after PECE and BLOCK_INTR_INPUTS gating, but before
BLOCK_INTR_OUTPUTS.
20:23 ROX ROX QME_CISR_OS_INTR_REQUESTED: "OS" External Interrupt for Thread 0..3 is a requested wakeup source for this Core after PECE and BLOCK_INTR_INPUTS gating, but before
BLOCK_INTR_OUTPUTS.
24:27 ROX ROX QME_CISR_MSGSND_INTR_REQUESTED: Hypervisor Doorbell Interrupt for Thread 0..3 is a requested wakeup source for this Core after PECE and BLOCK_INTR_INPUTS gating, but before
BLOCK_INTR_OUTPUTS.
28:31 ROX ROX QME_CISR_MSGSND_INTR_SAMPLE: Value of the Hypervisor Doorbell Interrupt Pulsed input for Thread 0..3 sampled from the interface. This value is used as the set term for the
"sticky" latch.
32 ROX ROX QME_CISR_MSGSND_ACK: Value of the MSGSND Acknowledgment from this physical Core (information only). This value is the clear condition for both the msgsnd and msgsndu
"sticky" hold. This is necessary to ensure Core has received the wakeup condition after being in Stop state.
NOTE: Core should not ACK if PC_BLOCK_INTR is set. TODO does this fix windows....before block was set
33 ROX ROX QME_CISR_MALF_ALERT_PRESENT: Value of the Malfunction Alert from the ADU to cause a Hypervisor Maintenance Interrupt to all threads on all Cores in this Quad.
34 ROX ROX QME_CISR_MALF_ALERT_REQUESTED: Malfunction Alert is a requested wakeup source for all Cores in this Quad after PECE and BLOCK_INTR_INPUTS gating, but before BLOCK_INTR_OUTPUTS has
been applied
35 RO RO constant=0b0
36:39 ROX ROX QME_CISR_MSGSNDU_INTR_PRESENT: Sticky Value of the Ultravisor Doorbell Interrupt from the XIVE interrupt controller for Thread 0..3 of this Core, cleared when acknowledged by the
Core.
40:43 ROX ROX QME_CISR_MSGSNDU_INTR_REQUESTED: Ultravisor Doorbell Interrupt for Thread 0..3 is a requested wakeup source for this Core Region after UDEE and BLOCK_INTR_INPUTS gating, but before
BLOCK_INTR_OUTPUTS.
44:47 ROX ROX QME_CISR_MSGSNDU_INTR_SAMPLE: Value of the Ultravisor Doorbell Interrupt Pulsed input for Thread 0..3 sampled from the interface. This value is used as the set term for the
"sticky" latch.
48:51 ROX ROX QME_CISR_TFCS_DEC_PRESENT: Raw value of most significant bit of the per-thread Decrementer in the TimeFac Shadow register, before any PECE or gating.
Copy of TFCSR[DEC_MSB].
52:55 ROX ROX QME_CISR_TFCS_DEC_REQUESTED: Wakeup condition is active from the Timefac Shadow version of the Decrementer and is not gated.
Specifically, each bit is set based on:
that threads TFCSR[DEC_MSB] AND PECE
AND that cores (CTFS_WKUP_ENABLE AND NOT BLOCK_INTR_INPUTS).
Note: BLOCK_INTR_OUTPUTS does not apply to this interrupt.
56 ROX ROX QME_CISR_TFCS_HDEC_PRESENT: Raw value of the OR of most significant bit of per-thread Hypervisor Decrementer from Timefac Shadow for this core, before any gating.
Copy of TFCSR[HDEC_MSB].
57 ROX ROX QME_CISR_TFCS_HDEC_REQUESTED: Wakeup condition is active from the Timefac Shadow version of the Hypervisor Decrementer and is not gated.
DD1 ERRATA (HW527236) - restriction for Stop1,2,3 PECE[EC] on all threads in a core must match if you are expect HDEC to wakeup.
Specifically, this bit is set based on:
OR of all 4 threads TFCSR[HDEC_MSB] AND
DD1 errata: NOR of all 4 threads PSSCR[EC] for that core
DD2 fix: per thread (TFCSR[HDEC_MSB] AND NOT PSSCR[EC])
AND that cores (CTFS_WKUP_ENABLE AND AND NOT BLOCK_INTR_INPUTS).
Note: BLOCK_INTR_OUTPUTS does not apply to this interrupt.
58 ROX ROX QME_CISR_DPDES_INTR_PRESENT: Value of the cross-coupled output from PC on the other core in the fused core pair. Core0 <-> Core1 and Core2 <-> Core3.
In other words, c0_other_dpdes_intr_pending feeds this field for Core1, and vice versa. Likewise for Core2 and Core3.
Note: on P9, DPDES was handled internally to the PC "common core" region and were presented to power management already swapped as part of the
pc_intr_pending from the core needing to wake up.
59 ROX ROX QME_CISR_DPDES_INTR_REQUESTED: DPDES from the other fused core in the pair is a requested wakeup source for this Core after AND OR_REDUCE(PECE) from all 4 threads on this core AND
BLOCK_INTR_INPUTS gating, but before BLOCK_INTR_OUTPUTS.
60 ROX ROX QME_CISR_PC_INTR_PENDING: The PC_INTR_PENDING input from the Core Pervasive logic is active, indicating that a core has a wakeup interrupt source pending.
61 ROX ROX QME_CISR_PC_INTR_REQUESTED: An interrupt from this core was requested directly, after being gated by BLOCK_INTR_INPUTS, but before BLOCK_INTR_OUTPUTS. Note that PECE gating is
not done in QME for this signal, but instead is done inside the core.
62 ROX ROX QME_CISR_REG_WKUP_PRESENT: OR of all the above PRESENT (and PENDING) interrupts in this register
63 ROX ROX QME_CISR_REG_WKUP_REQUESTED: OR of all the above REQUESTED interrupts in this register

QME Core Stop Instrumentation Register
Addr: 00000001C00887C0 (PPE)
00000000200E887C (SCOM)
Name:PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.QME_CSIR
Constant(s):
Comments:Provides PMSR bits 36:57 for Linux Stop State statistics.
If SCSR[AUTO_PMSR_SHIFT_DIS]=0, writes to this register cause a 64-bit serial shift of the contents of this register combined with the content of the PMSRS to occur to the corresponding Core. Bits 0:35 and 58:63 are provided by the PMSR register to form the full 64-bit data to be shifted.
SelectedAttributes:
LatchesBitsLatch Name [flushval]
36:57PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.CSIR_Q_36_INST.LATC.L2(36:57) [0000000000000000000000]
Bit(s)PPESCOM Dial: Description
0:35 RO RO constant=0b000000000000000000000000000000000000
36:57 RW RW QME_CSIR_PMSR_INSTR_DATA: Shifted into the core as PMSRS bits 36:57
58:63 RO RO constant=0b000000

QME QME per-Core Timing Facility Control & Status Register
Addr: 00000001C0088800 (PPE)
00000001C0088820 (PPE2)
00000001C0088830 (PPE1)
00000000200E8880 (SCOM)
00000000200E8882 (SCOM2)
00000000200E8883 (SCOM1)
Name:PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.QME_TFCSR
Constant(s):
Comments:This register manages the per-Core TimeFac Shadow Satellite (CTFS) control and status.
SelectedAttributes:
LatchesBitsLatch Name [flushval]
0PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.CTFS_XFER_START_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
1PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.CTFS_RESET_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
30:31PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.XX_CORE_NUM_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:1) [00]
32PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.XFER_RECEIVE_DONE_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
33PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.XFER_SENT_DONE_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
34PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.CTFS_INCOMING_ERR_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
35PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.CTFS_RUNTIME_ERR_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
36PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.CTFS_STATE_ERR_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
59PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.DUP_TFCSR_CTFS_MSB_HDEC_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
60:63PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.DUP_TFCSR_CTFS_MSB_DEC_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:3) [0000]
Bit(s)PPEPPE2PPE1SCOMSCOM2SCOM1Dial: Description
0 WO_4P WO_4P NC WO_4P WO_4P NC QME_TFCSR_XFER_START: Pulse requesting the TimeFac Shadow registers be transferred into the Core. After setting this bit using WO_OR, QME Hcode should poll on
XFER_SENT_DONE.
In DD2, QME Hcode must perform this sequence before setting SCSR[PC_COPY_FUSED_SPRs]. Also this bit can optionally be set prior to running the "self
restore" (when needed after Core power off) such that it can run in parallel to reduce latency.
DD1 ERRATA: due to HW534619, this sequence must be performed AFTER self restore (when needed after Core power off) and a SCOM write
In other words, for DD2 the QME Hcode sequence for wakeup is:
set XFER_START
perform steps as per CUCR[ENABLE_CORE_SHADOW]
run self restore (when needed) & wait for complete
poll for XFER_SENT_DONE=1
if core is in FUSED_MODE (or optionally always) AND the other core in the fused pair is not in or waking up from Stop>0, then do the following to the
other core in the fused pair:
set SCSR[PC_COPY_FUSED_SPRs]
poll for SCSR[PC_FUSED_COPY_DONE]=1
clear SCSR[PC_COPY_FUSED_SPRs]
start instructions by dropping PC_BLOCK_INTERRUPTS
The sequence for DD1 is:
perform steps as per CUCR[ENABLE_CORE_SHADOW]
When needed after core power off, run self restore & wait for complete then as a workaround SCOM write to 200284A3 (where data is a dont care)
set XFER_START
poll for XFER_SENT_DONE=1
start instructions by dropping PC_BLOCK_INTERRUPTS
WRITE_EFFECT {if (XFER_START==1) {} } AFTER_DELAY[large] { TFCSR.XFER_SENT_DONE=1;} //
1 WO_4P WO_4P NC WO_4P WO_4P NC QME_TFCSR_TFAC_RESET: Pulse requesting the TimeFac Shadow state machine to reset to INACTIVE.
This bit should be written by QME Hcode during Stop Exit using WO_OR if ERR bits are set or on timeout waiting for XFER_SENT_DONE.
Thus bit should also be written by QME hcode using WO_OR if Stop Entry is aborted (due to either a TFAC error, timeout on XFER_RECEIVE_DONE, or due to
L2,NCU, or HTM purge abort cases). Since the Core TFAC registers are still valid, there is no need to incur the latency (or introduce potential state
corruption) by shifting the shadow back into the Core. In addition to setting this bit for these abort cases, QME Hcode should clear XFER_RECEIVE_DONE
in this register and SCOM write to reset the Core timefac state machine to INACTIVE via PC TFX_SM[1].
In both of these Stop Entry and Exit cases, if below ERR bits are set, QME Hcode after setting this TFAC_RESET bit must save the ERR bits and then
clear them. QME Hcode ideally saves the ERR bits and timeout conditions in an Error Log for later analysis.
2:29 RO RO RO RO RO RO constant=0b0000000000000000000000000000
30:31 ROX NCX NCX ROX NCX NCX QME_TFCSR_CORE_NUM: Connected to scanonly latch that scan flushes to the core number represented by this register address, needed for SIMICs automated modeling similar to
the QUAD_NUM in the PIG.
32 RWX WOX_OR WOX_CLEAR RWX WOX_OR WOX_CLEAR QME_TFCSR_XFER_RECEIVE_DONE: Sticky indication that a Core-initiated transfer to the Shadow copy has completed. QME Hcode should poll on and then clear this bit using WO_CLEAR
after a stop entry request (PM_STATE_ACTIVE) is received. In addition, QME Hcode must check the ERR bits below, and if set abort the Stop Entry
(prior to stopping core clocks) and see TFAC_RESET description above.
33 RWX WOX_OR WOX_CLEAR RWX WOX_OR WOX_CLEAR QME_TFCSR_XFER_SENT_DONE: Sticky indication that a QME-initiated transfer from the Shadow copy to the Core has completed. QME should poll on and then clear this bit using
WO_CLEAR after requesting an XFER_START. In addition, QME Hcode must check the ERR bits below, and if are set see TFAC_RESET description above.
DD1 ERRATA HW540059: ONLY when in fused core, single lpar mode, Core wakeups from Stop>0 have a 25% chance to miss a count in PURR (and SPURR) and a
25% chance to get an extra count in PURR(and SPURR), and 50% chance to be correct.
34 RWX WOX_OR WOX_CLEAR RWX WOX_OR WOX_CLEAR QME_TFCSR_INCOMING_ERR: Sticky indication that an error asserted during a Core-initiated transfer to the shadow copy in QME.
Also sets ERR[CTFS_ERR] and the associated LFIR bit.
This bit is set by hardware when CTFS_ERR signal = "10", and should only be cleared by using WO_CLEAR.
Note that any accumulated parity errors that may occur while CTFS is inactive are suppressed by the timefac macro from being reported via this
mechanism and from setting ERR_RPT indications, since they are overwritten with correct values when the transfer from the other copy occurs.
35 RWX WOX_OR WOX_CLEAR RWX WOX_OR WOX_CLEAR QME_TFCSR_RUNTIME_ERR: Sticky indication that an error asserted during runtime while the timefac shadow is running. The Timefac shadow macro should suppress this error if a
transfer is currently in progress, so that stale parity errors are not reported.
Also sets ERR[CTFS_ERR] and the associated LFIR bit.
This bit is set by hardware when CTFS_ERR signal = "01", and should only be cleared by using WO_CLEAR.
36 RWX WOX_OR WOX_CLEAR RWX WOX_OR WOX_CLEAR QME_TFCSR_STATE_ERR: Sticky indication that a state machine error was detected (hardware checker).
Also sets ERR[CTFS_ERR] and the associated LFIR bit.
This bit is set by hardware when CTFS_ERR signal = "11", and should only be cleared by using WO_CLEAR.
37:58 RO RO RO RO RO RO constant=0b0000000000000000000000
59 ROX NCX NCX ROX NCX NCX QME_TFCSR_HDEC_MSB: For Debug. Raw value of the OR of the most significant bit of the per-thread Hypervisor Decrementers for this Core from CTFS.
60:63 ROX NCX NCX ROX NCX NCX QME_TFCSR_DEC_MSB: For Debug. Raw value of the most significant bit of the per-thread Decrementer for this Core from CTFS,

QME QME per-Core Quality of Service Request Register
Addr: 00000001C0088A00 (PPE)
00000000200E88A0 (SCOM)
Name:PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.QME_QOSR
Constant(s):
Comments:Defines relative fine throttle amount request per thread for Quality of Service resource management.
If QMCR[QOSR_SPR_UPDATE_ENABLE] =1, PCB writes to this register are ignored with invalid return code, in which case this register will instead be updated by a serial shifter from the Core via writes to a per-thread QoS SPR.
If QMCR[QOSR_SPR_UPDATE_ENABLE] =0, SPR updates are ignored without any other side effects.
Updates to this register via either mechanism set the QOS_UPDATE in EISR such that QME Hcode can be modeably interrupted (for the case that QMCR[QOS_AUTO_INDEX_UPDATE]=0) so Hcode can perform the requested amount of fine decode (DPT) instruction throttling in concert with the WOF request.
SelectedAttributes:
LatchesBitsLatch Name [flushval]
2:7PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.QOSR_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:5) [000000]
10:15PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.QOSR_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(6:11) [000000]
18:23PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.QOSR_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(12:17) [000000]
26:31PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.QOSR_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(18:23) [000000]
34:39PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.T0_DTC_INDEX(0:5) [000000]
42:47PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.T1_DTC_INDEX(0:5) [000000]
50:55PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.T2_DTC_INDEX(0:5) [000000]
58:63PCBSLEQ.QME.QME_REGS.PCR_C0.T3_DTC_INDEX(0:5) [000000]
Bit(s)PPESCOM Dial: Description
0:1 RO RO constant=0b00
2:7 RW RW T0_QOS_INDEX
8:9 RO RO constant=0b00
10:15 RW RW T1_QOS_INDEX
16:17 RO RO constant=0b00
18:23 RW RW T2_QOS_INDEX
24:25 RO RO constant=0b00
26:31 RW RW T3_QOS_INDEX
32:33 RO RO constant=0b00
34:39 ROX ROX T0_DTC_INDEX
40:41 RO RO constant=0b00
42:47 ROX ROX T1_DTC_INDEX
48:49 RO RO constant=0b00
50:55 ROX ROX T2_DTC_INDEX
56:57 RO RO constant=0b00
58:63 ROX ROX T3_DTC_INDEX

CPMS Core Analog Clock Grid Control & Status Register
Addr: 00000001C008E000 (PPE)
00000001C008E020 (PPE2)
00000001C008E030 (PPE1)
00000000200E8E00 (SCOM)
00000000200E8E02 (SCOM2)
00000000200E8E03 (SCOM1)
Name:PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CPMS_CGCSR
Constant(s):
Comments:Analog clock grid controls, implemented as a special CCFG type register for manufacturing test.
SelectedAttributes:
LatchesBitsLatch Name [flushval]
0:4PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CGCSR_REG.CCFG_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(0:4) [00000]
7:8PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CGCSR_REG.CCFG_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(5:6) [00]
11:15PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CGCSR_REG.CCFG_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(7:11) [00000]
32PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.AN_TCEQ_L3XX_CLK_SYNC_DONE_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
33PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.AN_TCEQ_CXX_CLK_SYNC_DONE_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
Bit(s)PPEPPE2PPE1SCOMSCOM2SCOM1Dial: Description
0 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CGCSR_L3_CLK_SYNC_ENABLE: Clock Sync Enable for the L3 Cache Clock Grid to the Analog Clock SKEWADJ macro.
After setting this bit ,code must wait for CORE_CLK_SYNC_DONE bit to assert before enabling at-speed functional clocks on the grid via L3_CLKGLM_SEL.
Likewise, after clearing this bit, code must wait for the corresponding bit to deassert, before switching the clock grid away from full speed clocks.
This signal must remain asserted for the clock grid to remain synchronous with the other grids in the Quad.
WRITE_EFFECT{ } AFTER_DELAY[small] {CGCSR.L3_CLK_SYNC_DONE=CGCSR.L3_CLK_SYNC_ENABLE;} //
1 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CGCSR_CL2_CLK_SYNC_ENABLE: Clock Sync Enable for the CoreL2 Clock Grid to the Analog Clock SKEWADJ macro. Same description as above.
WRITE_EFFECT { } AFTER_DELAY[small] {CGCSR.CL2_CLK_SYNC_DONE=CGCSR.CL2_CLK_SYNC_ENABLE;} //
2 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CGCSR_ANALOG_SENSOR_INPUT_GATE: DD1: Reserved
DD2: Used for DFT to force analog sensor inputs to 0. This includes CLK_SYNC and RVID information
3 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CGCSR_PFET_SENSE_INPUT_GATE: DD1: Reserved
DD2: Used for DFT to force PFET sense inputs to 0.
4 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CGCSR_L3_CLKGLM_ASYNC_RESET: Glitchless clock mux async reset for the L3 Cache grid.
5:6 RO RO RO RO RO RO constant=0b00
7 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CGCSR_L3_CLKGLM_SEL: Glitchless clock mux select for the L3 Cache grid.
0: 32Mhz timer pulse (for BTI)
1: DPLL full speed Div1 output
8 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CGCSR_CL2_CLKGLM_ASYNC_RESET: Glitchless clock mux async reset for the CoreL2 grid.
9:10 RO RO RO RO RO RO constant=0b00
11 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CGCSR_CL2_CLKGLM_SEL: Glitchless clock mux select for the CoreL2 grid.
0: 32Mhz timer pulse (for BTI)
1: DPLL full speed Div1 output
12:15 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CGCSR_L3_CACHE_SB_CTRL: L3 Cache Sector buffer drive strength.
Intended to be set at IPL time and static during runtime.
16:31 RO RO RO RO RO RO constant=0b0000000000000000
32 ROX NCX NCX ROX NCX NCX CPMS_CGCSR_L3_CLK_SYNC_DONE: Clock Sync Done for this L3 Cache Region.
When changing the L3_CLK_SYNC_ENABLE bit, code must wait for this bit to transition to the same value before proceeding. The SKEWADJ macro is not
allowed to change the value of this signal unless the corresponding enable changes first, otherwise the corresponding CERR[L3_CLK_SYNC_ERR] will be
set.
33 ROX NCX NCX ROX NCX NCX CPMS_CGCSR_CL2_CLK_SYNC_DONE: Clock Sync Done for this Core Region.
Same description as above.
34:63 RO RO RO RO RO RO constant=0b000000000000000000000000000000

CPMS Retention Voltage Control & Status Register
Addr: 00000001C008E040 (PPE)
00000001C008E060 (PPE2)
00000001C008E070 (PPE1)
00000000200E8E04 (SCOM)
00000000200E8E06 (SCOM2)
00000000200E8E07 (SCOM1)
Name:PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CPMS_RVCSR
Constant(s):
Comments:Analog retention voltage regulation circuit (rVRM), implemented as a special CCFG type register for manufacturing test.
Note that only VDD for the Core+L2 VDD is reduced using RVRM, VCS on Core+L2 is unaffected. L3 Cache voltages are also unaffected.
SelectedAttributes:
LatchesBitsLatch Name [flushval]
0:2PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.RVCSR_REG.CCFG_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(0:2) [000]
6:11PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.RVCSR_REG.CCFG_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(3:8) [000000]
32PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.RVCSR_INPUTS.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(1) [0]
33PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.BYPASS_ACTIVE_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
34PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.RVID_ENABLED_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
35PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.RVCSR_INPUTS.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(0) [0]
Bit(s)PPEPPE2PPE1SCOMSCOM2SCOM1Dial: Description
0 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_RVCSR_RVID_ENABLE: Request to activate the rVRM to drop the CoreL2 region to the voltage specified in RVCR[RVID_VALUE]. This bit is ANDd with NOT RVID_OVERRIDE before
being sent to the rVRM circuit.
Note: Hcode can change the value of this bit at any time, e.g. to abort a request to go into "retention" voltage.
Before asserting this bit, Hcode should:
Clock & Power off the MMA if not already.
Set CL2_PFETCTRL[VDD_PFET_REGULATION_FINGER_SET] =1
Set CL2_PFETCTRL[VDD_PFET_SEQ_STATE]="01"
Poll for CL2_PFETCTRL[VDD_PG_STATE]=8
Verify CL2_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL(0:7) = 0x80
Wait 50ns
Assert RVID_ENABLE
Optionally (e.g. during initial bringup) poll for RVID_ENABLED
Note: this assumes the CL2_POWDN_DLY is at least as big as the propagation time through the header daisy chain.
Before clearing this bit, Hcode should poll for RVID_ENABLED to ensure that the RVRM has been properly functioning.
After clearing this bit, Hcode should:
Poll until BYPASS_ACTIVE is set for two consecutive samples
Set CL2_PFETCTRL[VDD_PFET_SEQ_STATE]="11"
DD1: Poll for CL2_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE = 1
DD2: CL2_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL(0:7) = 0xFF
Set CL2_PFETCTRL[VDD_PFET_REGULATION_FINGER_SET] = 0
WRITE_EFFECT{
if (RVID_ENABLE==0) RVCSR.RVID_ACTIVE = 0;
else RVCSR.BYPASS_ACTIVE = 0;
} AFTER_DELAY[small] {
RVCSR.RVID_ACTIVE = RVCSR.RVID_ENABLE & ~RVCSR.RVID_OVERRIDE;
RVCSR.BYPASS_ACTIVE = ~RVCSR.RVID_ENABLE;
RVCSR.RVID_ENABLED = RVID_ENABLE | RVCSR.RVID_OVERRIDE; } //
1 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_RVCSR_RVID_OVERRIDE: Allows an external entity, such as PGPE, to disable enablement of the rVRM circuit due to Stop state. This inverse of this bit is ANDd with the
RVID_ENABLE. This could be used to disable RVRMs dynamically based on Pstate crossing in or out of the deadzone.
2 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_RVCSR_ACS_CALIBRATE: Sends a signal to the Analog Current Sensor requesting it to perform internal calibration. (Unrelated to RVRM, but measures the current of the Core
VDD voltage grid as sampled by ASSR)
3:5 RO RO RO RO RO RO constant=0b000
6:11 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_RVCSR_RVRM_TUNE: Analog tuning.
Bits0:2 control the speed of exiting retention mode (essentially time between RVRM_REG_ENABLE going low and RVRM_REG_BYPASS going high):
000 = 4us (slowest)
001 = 2us
...
101 => 32ns
110 => 64ns
111 =>No clock assigned (once in retention, never exit)
Bit3 selects clock frequency: 0 = ~250MHz (lower power); 1 = ~ 500MHz
Bit4:selects reference voltage: 0 = QME RVID; 1= resister ladder off VDD
Bit5:tunes amplifier steady state current: 0 = less power 1 = more power
12:31 RO RO RO RO RO RO constant=0b00000000000000000000
32 ROX NCX NCX ROX NCX NCX CPMS_RVCSR_RVID_ACTIVE: rVRM indicates that the voltage is at retention as specified by RVID_VALUE (OR as low as the circuit can achieve if operating in dropout/deadzone).
NOTE: this is the direct input from the RVRM
33 ROX NCX NCX ROX NCX NCX CPMS_RVCSR_BYPASS_ACTIVE: rVRM indicates voltage has been restored back to full value.
Hcode should poll for this bit to be set after writing RVID_ENABLE=0 before continuing with core wakeup.
DD1 NOTE: this is the direct input from the RVRM
DD2 NOTE: the bypass input from the rVRM is further qualified by
(NOT RVID_ENABLE OR RVID_OVERRIDE) AND NOT RVID_ACTIVE)
34 ROX NCX NCX ROX NCX NCX CPMS_RVCSR_RVID_ENABLED: This field is used to determine that the rVRM enablement sequencing is complete. This is set by (RVID_ACTIVE OR RVID_OVERRIDE).
Use of this bit is optional to verify the retention circuitry is properly functioning.
35 ROX NCX NCX ROX NCX NCX CPMS_RVCSR_BYPASS_RAW: DD1: Not Implemented
DD2: this is the direct input from the RVRM, As a DD2 enhancement, when RVID_OVERRIDE is not set, this field (after allowing for small transition
time after setting the RVID_ENABLE) indicates that the RVRM is in DROPOUT (a regulation deadzone where the RVRM cannot properly regulate the voltage
anymore because the input voltage is too close to the RVID set point).
Hcode can query this field in the unlikely case of a timeout waiting for RVID_ENABLED to determine if the reason was due to the RVRM being in DROPOUT
(regulation deadzone).
Note this input being asserted when the RVID_ACTIVE input is also asserted may also set CERR[RVRM_DROPOUT]
36:63 RO RO RO RO RO RO constant=0b0000000000000000000000000000

CPMS QME CPMS Error Register
Addr: 00000001C008E100 (PPE)
00000000200E8E10 (SCOM)
Name:PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CPMS_CERR
Constant(s):
Comments:CPMS error register. Each individual bit is sticky when set and is only cleared by a SCOM write to this address. The OR of these bits after applying the CERRMSK feed a corresponding LFIR bit in QME. Can be used to stop trace arrays or as a debug trigger TBD.
SelectedAttributes:
LatchesBitsLatch Name [flushval]
0:15PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CERR_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:15) [0000000000000000]
Bit(s)PPESCOM Dial: Description
0 RWX_WCLEAR RWX_WCLEAR CPMS_CERR_L3_PFET_SEQ_ERR: The VDD or VCS PFET sequencer for L3 Cache reached an invalid state due to incorrect configuration by a program.
1 RWX_WCLEAR RWX_WCLEAR CPMS_CERR_CL2_PFET_SEQ_ERR: The VDD or VCS PFET sequencer for Core+L2 reached an invalid state due to incorrect configuration by a program.
2 RWX_WCLEAR RWX_WCLEAR CPMS_CERR_MMA_PFET_SEQ_ERR: The VDD PFET sequencer for MMA sub-region of the Core reached an invalid state due to incorrect configuration by a program.
3 RWX_WCLEAR RWX_WCLEAR CPMS_CERR_DDS_ERR: DDS output a non-thermometer code, reported as 0x1E DDS data.
4 RWX_WCLEAR RWX_WCLEAR CPMS_CERR_L3_CLOCK_SYNC_ERR: The SKEWADJ macro violated the agreed protocol by changing the value of
the L3_CLK_SYNC_DONE without a corresponding L3_CLK_SYNC_ENABLE change. (i.e. rising edge of the DONE when ENABLE=0 or falling edge of
the DONE when ENABLE=1).
5 RWX_WCLEAR RWX_WCLEAR CPMS_CERR_CL2_CLOCK_SYNC_ERR: Same as above, but for the CL2_CLK_SYNC.
6 RWX_WCLEAR RWX_WCLEAR CPMS_CERR_DPT_ACCESS_ERROR: Either:
A) DTIR was written to manually control the Fine Decode Throttle interface when the Core was in a Stop state or when already pending DPT interface
updates were in progress, meaning the Core just exited a Stop state or another Firmware entity just wrote the DTCR or DTTR.
or
B) DTIR was written with an bad value, namely with DPT_THREAD_SEL == "1XX" when CUCR[DPT_PER_THREAD_MODE]==0, or with "000" when
CUCR[DPT_PER_THREAD_MODE]==1
or
C) DTTR was written when CUCR[DPT_PER_THREAD_MODE]==0
7 RWX_WCLEAR RWX_WCLEAR CPMS_CERR_PROXY_UNDERFLOW: Power Proxy Activity Accumulator inside the Core underflowed (pre-Scale Factor).
8 RWX_WCLEAR RWX_WCLEAR CPMS_CERR_PITCH_SATURATED: Set on rising edge of PPSR[PITCH_SATURATED].
9:11 RWX_WCLEAR RWX_WCLEAR CPMS_CERR_FTC_DEBUG_EVENT: Wired to the Droop Events A, B, and C respectively, as specified in DESR, to allow reporting to debug trigger, FIR, or QME interrupt for further
processing or action. (e.g. stop clocks and read DDS history out of the trace array).
12 RWX_WCLEAR RWX_WCLEAR CPMS_CERR_CCFG_PARITY_ERR: One of the several CCFG registers detected a parity error. This can only happen if a bit flip occurs during runtime.
13 RWX_WCLEAR RWX_WCLEAR CPMS_CERR_RVRM_DROPOUT: DD1: Not Implemented
DD2: RVRM is in DROPOUT (regulation deadzone) where it can no longer control the voltage, typically because the input voltage rail is too close to
RVID.
This bit is set when (bypass input from the rVRM is asserted) AND RVCSR bits
(RVID_ENABLE AND NOT RVID_OVERRIDE) AND RVID_ACTIVE), meaning the RVRM had activated but then hit the edge (or maybe even exceeded the point) of being
able to properly regulate voltage.
14 RWX_WCLEAR RWX_WCLEAR CPMS_CERR_PITCH_UPDATE_ERR: Indicates an Hcode bug tried to update the PITCH state machine (via write to WPCR) for a new interval when the previous interval was still active.
15 RWX_WCLEAR RWX_WCLEAR CPMS_CERR_SPARE_ERR: Implemented but not used
16:63 RO RO constant=0b000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000

CPMS QME CPMS Error Mask Register
Addr: 00000001C008E140 (PPE)
00000000200E8E14 (SCOM)
Name:PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CPMS_CERRMSK
Constant(s):
Comments:CPMS error mask register. Note that only the FTC_EVENTs are masked by default.
SelectedAttributes:
LatchesBitsLatch Name [flushval]
0:12PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CERRMASK_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:12) [0000000000000]
Bit(s)PPESCOM Dial: Description
0 RW RW CPMS_CERRMSK_PFET_SEQ_ERR_MASK: Set to prevent the PFET Sequencer Errors in bits 0:2 of CERR from sending CPMS_ERR to the QME LFIR.
0: Error is allowed to set LFIR
1: Error is blocked from setting LFIR
1 RW RW CPMS_CERRMSK_DDS_ERR_MASK: Set to prevent the DDS_ERR in bit 3 of CERR from sending CPMS_ERR to the QME LFIR.
2 RW RW CPMS_CERRMSK_CLK_SYNC_ERR_MASK: Set to prevent the Clock Sync Errors in bits 4:5 of CERR from sending CPMS_ERR to the QME LFIR.
3 RW RW CPMS_CERRMSK_DPT_ACCESS_MASK: Set to prevent the corresponding DPT_ACCESS_ERROR in bit 6 of CERR from sending CPMS_ERR to the QME LFIR.
4 RW RW CPMS_CERRMSK_PROXY_MASK: Set to prevent the corresponding PROXY error bit 7 of CERR from sending CPMS_ERR to the QME LFIR.
5:7 RW RW CPMS_CERRMSK_FTC_EVENT_MASK: Set to prevent the FTC Events in bits 9:11 of CERR from sending CPMS_ERR to the QME LFIR.
8 RW RW CPMS_CERRMSK_PITCH_MASK: Set to prevent the corresponding PITCH error bit 8 of CERR from sending CPMS_ERR to the QME LFIR.
9 RW RW CPMS_CERRMSK_CCFG_PARITY_MASK: Set to prevent bit 12 of the CERR from sending CPMS_ERR to the QME LFIR.
10 RW RW CPMS_CERRMSK_RVRM_DROPOUT_MASK: DD1: Not Implemented
DD2: Set to prevent the RVRM Dropout condition from being reported to QME.
11 RW RW CPMS_CERRMSK_PITCH_UPDATE_MASK: DD1: Not Implemented
DD2: Set to prevent the PITCH_UPDATE_ERR from being reported to QME.
12 RW RW CPMS_CERRMSK_SPARE_MASK: DD1: Not Implemented
DD2: Set to prevent the SPARE_ERR condition from being reported to QME.
13:63 RO RO constant=0b000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000

CPMS QME Analog Sample Summary Register
Addr: 00000001C008E180 (PPE)
00000000200E8E18 (SCOM)
Name:PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CPMS_ASSR
Constant(s):
Comments:Summary of Analog outputs from Core, MMA, and L3 PFET sense inputs, Core rVRM status, CL2 & L3clock grid,
SelectedAttributes:
LatchesBitsLatch Name [flushval]
0:1PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.ENABLED_SENSE_LAT.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(6:7) [00]
2:3PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.ENABLED_SENSE_LAT.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(0:1) [00]
4:5PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.ENABLED_SENSE_LAT.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(4:5) [00]
6PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.RVCSR_INPUTS.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(1) [0]
7PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.RVCSR_INPUTS.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(0) [0]
8PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CL2_PFETCNTL_REG.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(8) [0]
12:13PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.ENABLED_SENSE_LAT.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(8:9) [00]
14:15PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.ENABLED_SENSE_LAT.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(2:3) [00]
16PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CGCSR_REG.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(5) [0]
17PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CGCSR_REG.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(7) [0]
18PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.AN_TCEQ_L3XX_CLK_SYNC_DONE_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
19PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.AN_TCEQ_CXX_CLK_SYNC_DONE_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
20:24PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.ENABLED_SENSE_LAT.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(10:14) [00000]
27:31PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CL2_VDD_CURRENT_SENSE_AVG_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:4) [00000]
32:36PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CL2_VDD_CURRENT_SENSE0_DECODED_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:4) [00000]
37:41PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CL2_VDD_CURRENT_SENSE1_DECODED_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:4) [00000]
42:46PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CL2_VDD_CURRENT_SENSE2_DECODED_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:4) [00000]
47:51PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CL2_VDD_CURRENT_SENSE3_DECODED_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:4) [00000]
52:56PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CL2_VDD_CURRENT_SENSE_MAX_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:4) [00000]
57:61PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CL2_VDD_CURRENT_SENSE_MIN_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:4) [00000]
Bit(s)PPESCOM Dial: Description
0 ROX ROX CPMS_L3_PFETSTAT_VDD_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE: PFET Enabled Sense Sample of the L3 Cache VDD PFET output summary, providing an AND of all 8 controls as seen at the end of the daisy chain. Provides
continuity check that all PFETs have seen the correct value and have all been enabled.
1 ROX ROX CPMS_L3_PFETSTAT_VDD_PFETS_DISABLED_SENSE: PFET Disabled Sense Sample of the L3 Cache VDD PFET output summary, providing a NOR of all 8 controls as seen at the end of the daisy chain. Provides
continuity check that all PFETs have seen the correct value and have all been disabled.
2 ROX ROX CPMS_CL2_PFETSTAT_VDD_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE: PFET Enabled Sense Sample of the Core & VDD PFET output summary, providing an AND of all 8 controls as seen at the end of the daisy chain. Provides
continuity check that all PFETs have seen the correct value and have all been enabled.
NOTE: when rVRMs are enabled, this bit will not be set since only a single finger is used for regulation.
3 ROX ROX CPMS_CL2_PFETSTAT_VDD_PFETS_DISABLED_SENSE: PFET Disabled Sense Sample of the Core & L2 VDD PFET output summary, providing a NOR of all 8 controls as seen at the end of the daisy chain.
Provides continuity check that all PFETs have seen the correct value and have all been disabled.
4 ROX ROX CPMS_MMA_PFETSTAT_VDD_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE: PFET Enabled Sense Sample of the Core MMA VDD PFET output summary, providing an AND of all 8 controls as seen at the end of the daisy chain. Provides
continuity check that all PFETs have seen the correct value and have all been enabled.
5 ROX ROX CPMS_MMA_PFETSTAT_VDD_PFETS_DISABLED_SENSE: PFET Disabled Sense Sample of the Core MMA VDD PFET output summary, providing a NOR of all 8 controls as seen at the end of the daisy chain. Provides
continuity check that all PFETs have seen the correct value and have all been disabled.
6 ROX ROX CPMS_RVCSR_RVID_ACTIVE: rVRM indicates that the voltage is at retention as specified by RVID_VALUE (OR as low as the circuit can achieve if operating in dropout/deadzone).
NOTE: this is the direct input from the RVRM
7 ROX ROX CPMS_RVCSR_BYPASS_RAW: DD1: Not Implemented
DD2: this is the direct input from the RVRM, As a DD2 enhancement, when RVID_OVERRIDE is not set, this field (after allowing for small transition
time after setting the RVID_ENABLE) indicates that the RVRM is in DROPOUT (a regulation deadzone where the RVRM cannot properly regulate the voltage
anymore because the input voltage is too close to the RVID set point).
Hcode can query this field in the unlikely case of a timeout waiting for RVID_ENABLED to determine if the reason was due to the RVRM being in DROPOUT
(regulation deadzone).
Note this input being asserted when the RVID_ACTIVE input is also asserted may also set CERR[RVRM_DROPOUT]
8 ROX ROX CPMS_CL2_PFETCNTL_VDD_PFET_REGULATION_FINGER_SET: VDD Domain PFET Regulation Finger Set
Intended to be used to control the Regulation PFET enable bit 0 when rVRMs are enabled.
DD1 ERRATA: (CQ HW518713) this bit must be set set after transitioning MMA to Von and before checking MMA VDD_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE, and must be cleared
before transitioning MMA to Voff.

Dial enums:
REGULATION_FINGER_IS_CONTROLLED_AS_NORMAL_BY_THE_PFET_FSM=>0b0
REGULATION_FINGER_IS_OVERRIDDEN_TO_1=>0b1
9:11 RO RO constant=0b000
Dial enums:
REGULATION_FINGER_IS_CONTROLLED_AS_NORMAL_BY_THE_PFET_FSM=>0b0
REGULATION_FINGER_IS_OVERRIDDEN_TO_1=>0b1
12 ROX ROX CPMS_L3_PFETSTAT_VCS_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE: PFET Enabled Sense Sample of the L3 Cache VCS PFET output summary, providing an AND of all 8 controls as seen at the end of the daisy chain. Provides
continuity check that all PFETs have seen the correct value and have all been enabled.
13 ROX ROX CPMS_L3_PFETSTAT_VCS_PFETS_DISABLED_SENSE: PFET Disabled Sense Sample of the L3 Cache VDD PFET output summary, providing a NOR of all 8 controls as seen at the end of the daisy chain. Provides
continuity check that all PFETs have seen the correct value and have all been disabled.
14 ROX ROX CPMS_CL2_PFETSTAT_VCS_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE: PFET Enabled Sense Sample of the Core & L2 VCS PFET output summary, providing an AND of all 8 controls as seen at the end of the daisy chain.
Provides continuity check that all PFETs have seen the correct value and have all been enabled.
15 ROX ROX CPMS_CL2_PFETSTAT_VCS_PFETS_DISABLED_SENSE: PFET Disabled Sense Sample of the Core & L2 VDD PFET output summary, providing a NOR of all 8 controls as seen at the end of the daisy chain.
Provides continuity check that all PFETs have seen the correct value and have all been disabled.
16 ROX ROX L3_CLKGLM_SEL
17 ROX ROX L2_CLKGLM_SEL
18 ROX ROX CPMS_CGCSR_L3_CLK_SYNC_DONE: Clock Sync Done for this L3 Cache Region.
When changing the L3_CLK_SYNC_ENABLE bit, code must wait for this bit to transition to the same value before proceeding. The SKEWADJ macro is not
allowed to change the value of this signal unless the corresponding enable changes first, otherwise the corresponding CERR[L3_CLK_SYNC_ERR] will be
set.
19 ROX ROX CPMS_CGCSR_CL2_CLK_SYNC_DONE: Clock Sync Done for this Core Region.
Same description as above.
20 ROX ROX CPMS_L3_PFETSTAT_L3_VDD_PFETS_FINGER0_SENSE: PFET Finger0 Sense Sample of the L3 Cache VDD PFET output finger0 control signal at the end of the PFET header daisy chain. Allows firmware to check
only the most important PFET header control representing almost 99% of the width which is sufficient for runtime operation.
21 ROX ROX CPMS_L3_PFETSTAT_L3_VCS_PFETS_FINGER0_SENSE: PFET Finger0 Sense Sample of the L3 Cache VCS PFET output finger0 control signal at the end of the PFET header daisy chain. Allows firmware to check
only the most important PFET header control representing almost 99% of the width which is sufficient for runtime operation.
22 ROX ROX CPMS_CL2_PFETSTAT_L2_VDD_PFETS_FINGER0_SENSE: DD1 Not Implemented
DD2: PFET Finger0 Sense Sample of the Core & L2 VDD PFET output finger0 control signal at the end of the PFET header daisy chain. Allows firmware to
check only the most important PFET header control representing almost 99% of the width which is sufficient for runtime operation.
23 ROX ROX CPMS_CL2_PFETSTAT_L2_VCS_PFETS_FINGER0_SENSE: DD1 Not Implemented
DD2:PFET Finger0 Sense Sample of the Core & L2 VCS PFET output finger0 control signal at the end of the PFET header daisy chain. Allows firmware to
check only the most important PFET header control representing almost 99% of the width which is sufficient for runtime operation.
24 ROX ROX CPMS_MMA_PFETSTAT_VDD_PFETS_FINGER0_SENSE: DD1 Not Implemented
DD2:PFET Finger0 Sense Sample of the Core MMA VDD PFET output finger0 control signal at the end of the PFET header daisy chain. Allows firmware to
check only the most important PFET header control representing almost 99% of the width which is sufficient for runtime operation.
25:26 RO RO constant=0b00
27:31 ROX ROX CL2_VDD_CURRENT_AVG
32:36 ROX ROX CL2_VDD_CURRENT_SENSE0
37:41 ROX ROX CL2_VDD_CURRENT_SENSE1
42:46 ROX ROX CL2_VDD_CURRENT_SENSE2
47:51 ROX ROX CL2_VDD_CURRENT_SENSE3
52:56 ROX ROX CL2_VDD_CURRENT_SENSE_MAX
57:61 ROX ROX CL2_VDD_CURRENT_SENSE_MIN
62:63 RO RO constant=0b00

CPMS QME PFET Delay Register
Addr: 00000001C008E1C0 (PPE)
00000000200E8E1C (SCOM)
Name:PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CPMS_PFETDLY
Constant(s):
Comments:Core PFET power down and power up delay for L3C, CL2, and MMA voltage domains.
Note that this is implemented as a special CCFG type register for manufacturing test.
SelectedAttributes:
LatchesBitsLatch Name [flushval]
0:15PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.PFETDLY_REG.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(0:15) [0000000000000000]
Bit(s)PPESCOM Dial: Description
0:3 RW RW CPMS_PFETDLY_POWDN_DLY: Delay used between steps when powering down all VDD & VCS PFET domains.
Unlike P9, the delays in this register are in terms of the external timer "hang" pulse (~32ns) times 2^(12 minus this value).
Note: chooses the Power of 2 bit position of pfet_pg_timer(0:11) which is running off the external timer pulse (or cycle repro counter)
4:7 RW RW CPMS_PFETDLY_L3_POWUP_DLY: Delay used between steps powering up the L3 Cache VDD and VCS domain.
8:11 RW RW CPMS_PFETDLY_CL2_POWUP_DLY: Delay used between steps powering up the Core & L2 VDD and VCS domain.
Note: this should be tuned to match the power header daisy chain propagation time, to support RVRM
12:15 RW RW CPMS_PFETDLY_MMA_POWUP_DLY: Delay used between steps powering up the MMA VDD and VCS domain (unless MMA_FORCE_CL2 = 1).
16:63 RO RO constant=0b000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000

CPMS L3 Cache PFET Header Control Register
Addr: 00000001C008E200 (PPE)
00000001C008E220 (PPE2)
00000001C008E230 (PPE1)
00000000200E8E20 (SCOM)
00000000200E8E22 (SCOM2)
00000000200E8E23 (SCOM1)
Name:PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CPMS_L3_PFETCNTL
Constant(s):
Comments:PFET control & status register for powering off the local VDD and VCS voltage domains (rails)
Note: Same format as P9, except L3 cache does not have a VDD regulation finger for rVRM.
Note that only bits 0:35 and bit 63 are implemented as a special CCFG type register for manufacturing test.
SelectedAttributes:
LatchesBitsLatch Name [flushval]
0:7PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.L3_PFETCNTL_REG.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(0:7) [00000000]
12:35PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.L3_PFETCNTL_REG.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(8:31) [000000000000000000000000]
42:45PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.L3_VDD_PFET_SEQ.PG_STATE_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:3) [0000]
46:49PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.L3_VDD_PFET_SEQ.PG_SELECT_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:3) [0000]
50:53PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.L3_VCS_PFET_SEQ.PG_STATE_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:3) [0000]
54:57PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.L3_VCS_PFET_SEQ.PG_SELECT_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:3) [0000]
63PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.L3_PFETCNTL_REG.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(32) [0]
Bit(s)PPEPPE2PPE1SCOMSCOM2SCOM1Dial: Description
0:1 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_L3_PFETCNTL_VDD_PFET_SEQ_STATE: VDD Domain PFET State using the hardware sequencer.
b00 = No operation
b01 = Transition to Voff
b10 = No operation (reserved)
b11 = Transition to Von
This field is only valid if bits 4:5 = 00 (both vdd_pfet_val_override AND vdd_pfet_sel_override are disabled).
WRITE_EFFECT{ if (VDD_PFET_VAL_OVERRIDE==0 && VDD_PFET_SEL_OVERRIDE==0) {
if (VDD_PFET_SEQ_STATE==0b01 &&
L3_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL!=0x00) {
L3_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0x7F;
L3_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE=0;
VDD_PG_STATE=1; } else
if (VDD_PFET_SEQ_STATE==0b11 &&
L3_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL!=0xFF) {
L3_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0x01;
L3_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFETS_DISABLED_SENSE=0;
VDD_PG_STATE=1;
}}
} AFTER_DELAY[large] {
if (VDD_PFET_VAL_OVERRIDE==0 && VDD_PFET_SEL_OVERRIDE==0) {
if (VDD_PFET_SEQ_STATE==0b01) {
L3_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0x00;
L3_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFETS_DISABLED_SENSE=1;
VDD_PG_STATE=8; } else
if (VDD_PFET_SEQ_STATE==0b11) {
L3_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0xFF;
L3_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE=1;
VDD_PG_STATE=8;
}}} //
2:3 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_L3_PFETCNTL_VCS_PFET_SEQ_STATE: VCS Domain PFET State using the hardware sequencer.
b00 = No operation
b01 = Transition to Voff
b10 = No operation (reserved)
b11 = Transition to Von
This field is only valid if bits 6:7 = 00 (both vcs_pfet_val_override AND vcs_pfet_sel_override are disabled).
WRITE_EFFECT{ if (VCS_PFET_VAL_OVERRIDE==0 && VCS_PFET_SEL_OVERRIDE==0) {
if (VCS_PFET_SEQ_STATE==0b01 &&
L3_PFETSTAT.VCS_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL!=0x00) {
L3_PFETSTAT.VCS_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0x7F;
L3_PFETSTAT.VCS_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE=0;
VCS_PG_STATE=1; } else
if (VCS_PFET_SEQ_STATE==0b11 &&
L3_PFETSTAT.VCS_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL!=0xFF) {
L3_PFETSTAT.VCS_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0x01;
L3_PFETSTAT.VCS_PFETS_DISABLED_SENSE=0;
VCS_PG_STATE=1;
}}
} AFTER_DELAY[large] {
if (
VCS_PFET_VAL_OVERRIDE==0 && VCS_PFET_SEL_OVERRIDE==0) {
if (VCS_PFET_SEQ_STATE==0b01 && SRAM_ENABLE==0) {
L3_PFETSTAT.VCS_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0x00;
L3_PFETSTAT.VCS_PFETS_DISABLED_SENSE=~SRAM_ENABLE;
VCS_PG_STATE=8; } else
if (VCS_PFET_SEQ_STATE==0b11) {
L3_PFETSTAT.VCS_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0xFF;
L3_PFETSTAT.VCS_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE=1;
VCS_PG_STATE=8;
}}} // Note: Falsely using SRAM_ENABLE in the disable equation to guarantee the correct sequence is followed
4 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_L3_PFETCNTL_VDD_PFET_VAL_OVERRIDE: VDD Domain PFET Value Override

Dial enums:
OVERRIDE_IS_DISABLED=>0b0
OVERRIDE_IS_ENABLED=>0b1
5 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_L3_PFETCNTL_VDD_PFET_SEL_OVERRIDE: VDD Domain PFET Stage Select Override

Dial enums:
OVERRIDE_IS_DISABLED=>0b0
OVERRIDE_IS_ENABLED=>0b1
6 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_L3_PFETCNTL_VCS_PFET_VAL_OVERRIDE: VCS Domain PFET Value Override

Dial enums:
OVERRIDE_IS_DISABLED=>0b0
OVERRIDE_IS_ENABLED=>0b1
7 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_L3_PFETCNTL_VCS_PFET_SEL_OVERRIDE: VCS Domain PFET Stage Select Override

Dial enums:
OVERRIDE_IS_DISABLED=>0b0
OVERRIDE_IS_ENABLED=>0b1
8:11 RO RO RO RO RO RO constant=0b0000
Dial enums:
OVERRIDE_IS_DISABLED=>0b0
OVERRIDE_IS_ENABLED=>0b1
12:19 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_L3_PFETCNTL_VDD_PFET_ENABLE_VALUE: VDD Domain PFET Enable Value
Intended for manual control override usage, a write to this field sets the state of the PFET Enables directly.
If vdd_pfet_val_override = 1, a write to this field sets the state of the PFET Enables until vdd_pfet_val_override is cleared.
20:23 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_L3_PFETCNTL_VDD_PFET_SEL_VALUE: VDD Domain PFET Select Value
Intended for manual control override usage, a write to this field will index value N into the vdd_power_enable register where N is 0 to 8 if
vdd_pfet_sel_override = 1. If vdd_pfet_sel_override = 0, the field is written but no further action is taken.
0x0: 0b11111111 # On
0x1: 0b01111111
0x2: 0b00111111
0x3: 0b00011111
0x4: 0b00001111
0x5: 0b00000111
0x6: 0b00000011
0x7: 0b00000001
0x8: 0b00000000 # Off
x9:xF - Reserved
24:31 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_L3_PFETCNTL_VCS_PFET_ENABLE_VALUE: VCS Domain PFET Enable Value
Intended for manual control override usage, a write to this field sets the state of the VCS PFET Enables directly.
If vcs_pfet_val_override = 1, a write to this field sets the state of the VCS PFET Enables until vcs_pfet_val_override is cleared.
32:35 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_L3_PFETCNTL_VCS_PFET_SEL_VALUE: VCS Domain PFET Select Value
Intended for manual control override usage, a write to this field will index value N into the vcs_power_enable register where N is 0 to 8 if
vcs_pfet_sel_override = 1. If vcs_pfet_sel_override = 0, the field is written but no further action is taken.
0x0: 0b11111111 # On
0x1: 0b01111111
0x2: 0b00111111
0x3: 0b00011111
0x4: 0b00001111
0x5: 0b00000111
0x6: 0b00000011
0x7: 0b00000001
0x8: 0b00000000 # Off
x9:xF - Reserved
36:41 RO RO RO RO RO RO constant=0b000000
42:45 ROX NCX NCX ROX NCX NCX CPMS_L3_PFETCNTL_VDD_PG_STATE: For debug, Logic Voltage power gate sequencer FSM (1 hot)
0x8: Idle
0x4: Increment
0x2: Decrement
0x1: Wait
46:49 ROX NCX NCX ROX NCX NCX CPMS_L3_PFETCNTL_VDD_PG_SEL: For debug, contains the actual index N of the domain VDD PFET select value. See VDD_PFET_SEL_VALUE for encoding of N to power enable value.
50:53 ROX NCX NCX ROX NCX NCX CPMS_L3_PFETCNTL_VCS_PG_STATE: For debug, Array Voltage Domain power gate sequencer FSM (1 hot)
0x8: Idle
0x4: Increment
0x2: Decrement
0x1: Wait
54:57 ROX NCX NCX ROX NCX NCX CPMS_L3_PFETCNTL_VCS_PG_SEL: For debug, contains the actual index N of the domain VCS PFET select value. See VCS_PFET_SEL_VALUE for encoding of N to power enable value.
58:62 RO RO RO RO RO RO constant=0b00000
63 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_L3_PFETCNTL_SRAM_ENABLE: Enable SRAM circuits. Hcode must set this bit after enabling VDD and VCS and clear this bit before disabling VDD and VCS power.
WRITE_EFFECT {
L3_PFETSTAT.SRAM_ENABLE_ACTUAL=SRAM_ENABLE;
} //

CPMS L3 Cache PFET Header Status Register
Addr: 00000001C008E240 (PPE)
00000000200E8E24 (SCOM)
Name:PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CPMS_L3_PFETSTAT
Constant(s):
Comments:PFET Enable status register.
Note that only bits 0:31 are implemented as a special CCFG type register for manufacturing test.
SelectedAttributes:
LatchesBitsLatch Name [flushval]
0:5PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.ENABLED_SENSE_LAT.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(6:11) [000000]
16:23PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.L3_VDD_PFET_ENABLE.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(0:7) [00000000]
24:31PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.L3_VCS_PFET_ENABLE.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(0:7) [00000000]
63PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.L3_SRAM_ENABLE_ACTUAL_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
Bit(s)PPESCOM Dial: Description
0 ROX ROX CPMS_L3_PFETSTAT_VDD_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE: PFET Enabled Sense Sample of the L3 Cache VDD PFET output summary, providing an AND of all 8 controls as seen at the end of the daisy chain. Provides
continuity check that all PFETs have seen the correct value and have all been enabled.
1 ROX ROX CPMS_L3_PFETSTAT_VDD_PFETS_DISABLED_SENSE: PFET Disabled Sense Sample of the L3 Cache VDD PFET output summary, providing a NOR of all 8 controls as seen at the end of the daisy chain. Provides
continuity check that all PFETs have seen the correct value and have all been disabled.
2 ROX ROX CPMS_L3_PFETSTAT_VCS_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE: PFET Enabled Sense Sample of the L3 Cache VCS PFET output summary, providing an AND of all 8 controls as seen at the end of the daisy chain. Provides
continuity check that all PFETs have seen the correct value and have all been enabled.
3 ROX ROX CPMS_L3_PFETSTAT_VCS_PFETS_DISABLED_SENSE: PFET Disabled Sense Sample of the L3 Cache VDD PFET output summary, providing a NOR of all 8 controls as seen at the end of the daisy chain. Provides
continuity check that all PFETs have seen the correct value and have all been disabled.
4 ROX ROX CPMS_L3_PFETSTAT_L3_VDD_PFETS_FINGER0_SENSE: PFET Finger0 Sense Sample of the L3 Cache VDD PFET output finger0 control signal at the end of the PFET header daisy chain. Allows firmware to check
only the most important PFET header control representing almost 99% of the width which is sufficient for runtime operation.
5 ROX ROX CPMS_L3_PFETSTAT_L3_VCS_PFETS_FINGER0_SENSE: PFET Finger0 Sense Sample of the L3 Cache VCS PFET output finger0 control signal at the end of the PFET header daisy chain. Allows firmware to check
only the most important PFET header control representing almost 99% of the width which is sufficient for runtime operation.
6:15 RO RO constant=0b0000000000
16:23 ROX ROX CPMS_L3_PFETSTAT_VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL: PFET Control Sample of the actual output pins feeding the VDD PFET headers, after all logic and fuses have been applied.
24:31 ROX ROX CPMS_L3_PFETSTAT_VCS_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL: PFET Control Sample of the actual output pins feeding the VCS PFET headers, after all logic and fuses have been applied.
32:62 RO RO constant=0b0000000000000000000000000000000
63 ROX ROX CPMS_L3_PFETSTAT_SRAM_ENABLE_ACTUAL: Actual value of the output feeding the enable signal to the SRAM circuits.

CPMS Core & L2 (EL region) PFET Header Control Register
Addr: 00000001C008E280 (PPE)
00000001C008E2A0 (PPE2)
00000001C008E2B0 (PPE1)
00000000200E8E28 (SCOM)
00000000200E8E2A (SCOM2)
00000000200E8E2B (SCOM1)
Name:PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CPMS_CL2_PFETCNTL
Constant(s):
Comments:PFET control & status register for powering off the local VDD and VCS voltage domains (rails).
This register has the same format as P9 and controls the combined Core and L2 "EL" region.
Note that the regulation finger control for RVRM a single bit and only for VDD.
Note that only bits 0:35 and 58:63 are implemented as a special CCFG type register for manufacturing test.
SelectedAttributes:
LatchesBitsLatch Name [flushval]
0:8PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CL2_PFETCNTL_REG.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(0:8) [000000000]
12:35PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CL2_PFETCNTL_REG.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(9:32) [000000000000000000000000]
42:45PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CL2_VDD_PFET_SEQ.PG_STATE_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:3) [0000]
46:49PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CL2_VDD_PFET_SEQ.PG_SELECT_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:3) [0000]
50:53PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CL2_VCS_PFET_SEQ.PG_STATE_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:3) [0000]
54:57PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CL2_VCS_PFET_SEQ.PG_SELECT_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:3) [0000]
58:63PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CL2_PFETCNTL_REG.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(33:38) [000000]
Bit(s)PPEPPE2PPE1SCOMSCOM2SCOM1Dial: Description
0:1 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CL2_PFETCNTL_VDD_PFET_SEQ_STATE: VDD Domain PFET State using the hardware sequencer.
b00 = No operation
b01 = Transition to Voff
b10 = No operation (reserved)
b11 = Transition to Von
This field is only valid if bits 4:5 = 00 (both vdd_pfet_val_override AND vdd_pfet_sel_override are disabled).
WRITE_EFFECT{ if (VDD_PFET_VAL_OVERRIDE==0 && VDD_PFET_SEL_OVERRIDE==0) {
if (VDD_PFET_SEQ_STATE==0b01 &&
CL2_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL!=0x00) {
if ( VDD_PFET_REGULATION_FINGER_SET)
CL2_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0xBF; else
CL2_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0x7F;
CL2_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE=0;
VDD_PG_STATE=1;
if (MMA_PFETCNTL.MMA_FORCE_CL2==1) {
if ( VDD_PFET_REGULATION_FINGER_SET)
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0xBF; else
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0x7F;
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE=0;
} else if (MMA_PFETCNTL.VDD_PFET_VAL_OVERRIDE==0 &&
MMA_PFETCNTL.VDD_PFET_SEL_OVERRIDE==0 &&
MMA_PFETCNTL.VDD_PFET_SEQ_STATE==0b11) {
if ( VDD_PFET_REGULATION_FINGER_SET)
CL2_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL&=0xBF; else
CL2_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL&=0x7F;
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE=0;
}
} else if (VDD_PFET_SEQ_STATE==0b11 &&
CL2_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL!=0xFF) {
if ( VDD_PFET_REGULATION_FINGER_SET)
CL2_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0x81; else
CL2_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0x01;
CL2_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFETS_DISABLED_SENSE=0;
VDD_PG_STATE=1;
if (MMA_PFETCNTL.MMA_FORCE_CL2==1) {
if ( VDD_PFET_REGULATION_FINGER_SET)
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0x81; else
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0x01;
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFETS_DISABLED_SENSE=0;
} else if (MMA_PFETCNTL.VDD_PFET_VAL_OVERRIDE==0 &&
MMA_PFETCNTL.VDD_PFET_SEL_OVERRIDE==0 &&
MMA_PFETCNTL.VDD_PFET_SEQ_STATE==0b11) {
if ( VDD_PFET_REGULATION_FINGER_SET)
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL&=0x81; else
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL&=0x01;
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFETS_DISABLED_SENSE=0;
}
}
}
} AFTER_DELAY[large] {
if (VDD_PFET_VAL_OVERRIDE==0 && VDD_PFET_SEL_OVERRIDE==0) {
if (VDD_PFET_SEQ_STATE==0b01) {
if ( VDD_PFET_REGULATION_FINGER_SET)
CL2_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0x80; else
CL2_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0x00;
CL2_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFETS_DISABLED_SENSE=
~VDD_PFET_REGULATION_FINGER_SET;
VDD_PG_STATE=8;
if (MMA_PFETCNTL.MMA_FORCE_CL2==1 ||
(MMA_PFETCNTL.VDD_PFET_VAL_OVERRIDE==0 &&
MMA_PFETCNTL.VDD_PFET_SEL_OVERRIDE==0 &&
MMA_PFETCNTL.VDD_PFET_SEQ_STATE==0b11)) {
if ( VDD_PFET_REGULATION_FINGER_SET)
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0x80; else
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0x00;
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFETS_DISABLED_SENSE=
~VDD_PFET_REGULATION_FINGER_SET;
}} else if (VDD_PFET_SEQ_STATE==0b11) {
CL2_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0xFF;
CL2_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE=1;
VDD_PG_STATE=8;
if (MMA_PFETCNTL.MMA_FORCE_CL2==1 ||
(MMA_PFETCNTL.VDD_PFET_VAL_OVERRIDE==0 &&
MMA_PFETCNTL.VDD_PFET_SEL_OVERRIDE==0 &&
MMA_PFETCNTL.VDD_PFET_SEQ_STATE==0b11)) {
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0xFF;
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE=1;
}
}}
} //
2:3 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CL2_PFETCNTL_VCS_PFET_SEQ_STATE: VCS Domain PFET State using the hardware sequencer.
b00 = No operation
b01 = Transition to Voff
b10 = No operation (reserved)
b11 = Transition to Von
This field is only valid if bits 6:7 = 00 (both vcs_pfet_val_override AND vcs_pfet_sel_override are disabled).
WRITE_EFFECT{ if (VCS_PFET_VAL_OVERRIDE==0 && VCS_PFET_SEL_OVERRIDE==0) {
if (VCS_PFET_SEQ_STATE==0b01 &&
CL2_PFETSTAT.VCS_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL!=0x00) {
CL2_PFETSTAT.VCS_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0x7F;
CL2_PFETSTAT.VCS_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE=0;
VCS_PG_STATE=1; } else
if (VCS_PFET_SEQ_STATE==0b11 &&
CL2_PFETSTAT.VCS_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL!=0xFF) {
CL2_PFETSTAT.VCS_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0x01;
CL2_PFETSTAT.VCS_PFETS_DISABLED_SENSE=0;
VCS_PG_STATE=1;
}}
} AFTER_DELAY[large] {
if (
VCS_PFET_VAL_OVERRIDE==0 && VCS_PFET_SEL_OVERRIDE==0) {
if (VCS_PFET_SEQ_STATE==0b01 && SRAM_ENABLE==0) {
CL2_PFETSTAT.VCS_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0x00;
CL2_PFETSTAT.VCS_PFETS_DISABLED_SENSE=~SRAM_ENABLE;
VCS_PG_STATE=8;} else
if (VCS_PFET_SEQ_STATE==0b11) {
CL2_PFETSTAT.VCS_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0xFF;
CL2_PFETSTAT.VCS_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE=1;
VCS_PG_STATE=8;
}}} // Note: Falsely using SRAM_ENABLE in the disable equation to guarantee the correct sequence is followed
4 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CL2_PFETCNTL_VDD_PFET_VAL_OVERRIDE: VDD Domain PFET Value Override

Dial enums:
OVERRIDE_IS_DISABLED=>0b0
OVERRIDE_IS_ENABLED=>0b1
5 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CL2_PFETCNTL_VDD_PFET_SEL_OVERRIDE: VDD Domain PFET Stage Select Override

Dial enums:
OVERRIDE_IS_DISABLED=>0b0
OVERRIDE_IS_ENABLED=>0b1
6 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CL2_PFETCNTL_VCS_PFET_VAL_OVERRIDE: VCS Domain PFET Value Override

Dial enums:
OVERRIDE_IS_DISABLED=>0b0
OVERRIDE_IS_ENABLED=>0b1
7 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CL2_PFETCNTL_VCS_PFET_SEL_OVERRIDE: VCS Domain PFET Stage Select Override

Dial enums:
OVERRIDE_IS_DISABLED=>0b0
OVERRIDE_IS_ENABLED=>0b1
8 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CL2_PFETCNTL_VDD_PFET_REGULATION_FINGER_SET: VDD Domain PFET Regulation Finger Set
Intended to be used to control the Regulation PFET enable bit 0 when rVRMs are enabled.
DD1 ERRATA: (CQ HW518713) this bit must be set set after transitioning MMA to Von and before checking MMA VDD_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE, and must be cleared
before transitioning MMA to Voff.

Dial enums:
REGULATION_FINGER_IS_CONTROLLED_AS_NORMAL_BY_THE_PFET_FSM=>0b0
REGULATION_FINGER_IS_OVERRIDDEN_TO_1=>0b1
9:11 RO RO RO RO RO RO constant=0b000
Dial enums:
REGULATION_FINGER_IS_CONTROLLED_AS_NORMAL_BY_THE_PFET_FSM=>0b0
REGULATION_FINGER_IS_OVERRIDDEN_TO_1=>0b1
12:19 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CL2_PFETCNTL_VDD_PFET_ENABLE_VALUE: VDD Domain PFET Enable Value
Intended for manual control override usage, a write to this field sets the state of the Core Domain PFET Enables directly.
If vdd_pfet_val_override = 1, a write to this field sets the state of the core PFET Enables until vdd_pfet_val_override is cleared.
20:23 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CL2_PFETCNTL_VDD_PFET_SEL_VALUE: VDD Domain PFET Select Value
Intended for manual control override usage, a write to this field will index value N into the vdd_power_enable register where N is 0 to 8 if
vdd_pfet_sel_override = 1. If vdd_pfet_sel_override = 0, the field is written but no further action is taken.
0x0: 0b11111111 # On
0x1: 0b01111111
0x2: 0b00111111
0x3: 0b00011111
0x4: 0b00001111
0x5: 0b00000111
0x6: 0b00000011
0x7: 0b00000001
0x8: 0b00000000 # Off
x9:xF - Reserved
24:31 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CL2_PFETCNTL_VCS_PFET_ENABLE_VALUE: VCS Domain PFET Enable Value
Intended for manual control override usage, a write to this field sets the state of the VCS PFET Enables directly.
If vcs_pfet_val_override = 1, a write to this field sets the state of the VCS PFET Enables until vcs_pfet_val_override is cleared.
32:35 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CL2_PFETCNTL_VCS_PFET_SEL_VALUE: VCS Domain PFET Select Value
Intended for manual control override usage, a write to this field will index value N into the vcs_power_enable register where N is 0 to 8 if
vcs_pfet_sel_override = 1. If vcs_pfet_sel_override = 0, the field is written but no further action is taken.
0x0: 0b11111111 # On
0x1: 0b01111111
0x2: 0b00111111
0x3: 0b00011111
0x4: 0b00001111
0x5: 0b00000111
0x6: 0b00000011
0x7: 0b00000001
0x8: 0b00000000 # Off
x9:xF - Reserved
36:41 RO RO RO RO RO RO constant=0b000000
42:45 ROX NCX NCX ROX NCX NCX CPMS_CL2_PFETCNTL_VDD_PG_STATE: For debug, Logic Voltage power gate sequencer FSM (1 hot)
0x8: Idle
0x4: Increment
0x2: Decrement
0x1: Wait
46:49 ROX NCX NCX ROX NCX NCX CPMS_CL2_PFETCNTL_VDD_PG_SEL: For debug, contains the actual index N of the domain VDD PFET select value. See VDD_PFET_SEL_VALUE for encoding of N to power enable value.
50:53 ROX NCX NCX ROX NCX NCX CPMS_CL2_PFETCNTL_VCS_PG_STATE: For debug, Array Voltage Domain power gate sequencer FSM (1 hot)
0x8: Idle
0x4: Increment
0x2: Decrement
0x1: Wait
54:57 ROX NCX NCX ROX NCX NCX CPMS_CL2_PFETCNTL_VCS_PG_SEL: For debug, contains the actual index N of the domain VCS PFET select value. See VCS_PFET_SEL_VALUE for encoding of N to power enable value.
58:61 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CL2_PFETCNTL_ACS_MINMAX_SEL: Bit per CL2 ACS Sense Point(0..3) that determines whether that sensor is factored into both CL2_VDD_CURRENT_SENSE_MAX & MIN fields in the ASSR.
62 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CL2_PFETCNTL_ACS_ENABLE: Enable "experimental" Analog Current Sensor circuits (reflected in the ASSR).
63 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CL2_PFETCNTL_SRAM_ENABLE: Enable SRAM circuits. Hcode must set this bit after enabling VDD and VCS and clear this bit before disabling VDD and VCS power.
WRITE_EFFECT {
L3_PFETSTAT.SRAM_ENABLE_ACTUAL=SRAM_ENABLE;
} //

CPMS Core & L2 PFET Header Status Register
Addr: 00000001C008E2C0 (PPE)
00000000200E8E2C (SCOM)
Name:PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CPMS_CL2_PFETSTAT
Constant(s):
Comments:PFET Enable status register.
Note that only bits 0:31 are implemented as a special CCFG type register for manufacturing test.
SelectedAttributes:
LatchesBitsLatch Name [flushval]
0:3PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.ENABLED_SENSE_LAT.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(0:3) [0000]
4:5PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.ENABLED_SENSE_LAT.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(12:13) [00]
16:23PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CL2_VDD_PFET_ENABLE.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(0:7) [00000000]
24:31PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CL2_VCS_PFET_ENABLE.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(0:7) [00000000]
63PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CL2_SRAM_ENABLE_ACTUAL_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
Bit(s)PPESCOM Dial: Description
0 ROX ROX CPMS_CL2_PFETSTAT_VDD_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE: PFET Enabled Sense Sample of the Core & VDD PFET output summary, providing an AND of all 8 controls as seen at the end of the daisy chain. Provides
continuity check that all PFETs have seen the correct value and have all been enabled.
NOTE: when rVRMs are enabled, this bit will not be set since only a single finger is used for regulation.
1 ROX ROX CPMS_CL2_PFETSTAT_VDD_PFETS_DISABLED_SENSE: PFET Disabled Sense Sample of the Core & L2 VDD PFET output summary, providing a NOR of all 8 controls as seen at the end of the daisy chain.
Provides continuity check that all PFETs have seen the correct value and have all been disabled.
2 ROX ROX CPMS_CL2_PFETSTAT_VCS_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE: PFET Enabled Sense Sample of the Core & L2 VCS PFET output summary, providing an AND of all 8 controls as seen at the end of the daisy chain.
Provides continuity check that all PFETs have seen the correct value and have all been enabled.
3 ROX ROX CPMS_CL2_PFETSTAT_VCS_PFETS_DISABLED_SENSE: PFET Disabled Sense Sample of the Core & L2 VDD PFET output summary, providing a NOR of all 8 controls as seen at the end of the daisy chain.
Provides continuity check that all PFETs have seen the correct value and have all been disabled.
4 ROX ROX CPMS_CL2_PFETSTAT_L2_VDD_PFETS_FINGER0_SENSE: DD1 Not Implemented
DD2: PFET Finger0 Sense Sample of the Core & L2 VDD PFET output finger0 control signal at the end of the PFET header daisy chain. Allows firmware to
check only the most important PFET header control representing almost 99% of the width which is sufficient for runtime operation.
5 ROX ROX CPMS_CL2_PFETSTAT_L2_VCS_PFETS_FINGER0_SENSE: DD1 Not Implemented
DD2:PFET Finger0 Sense Sample of the Core & L2 VCS PFET output finger0 control signal at the end of the PFET header daisy chain. Allows firmware to
check only the most important PFET header control representing almost 99% of the width which is sufficient for runtime operation.
6:15 RO RO constant=0b0000000000
16:23 ROX ROX CPMS_CL2_PFETSTAT_VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL: PFET Control Sample of the actual output pins feeding the VDD PFET headers, after all logic and fuses have been applied.
MODEL_DESTINATION_EFFECT[
when this field == 0x00, SIMICs should zero out the Core SPR state
]
24:31 ROX ROX CPMS_CL2_PFETSTAT_VCS_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL: PFET Control Sample of the actual output pins feeding the VCS PFET headers, after all logic and fuses have been applied.
32:62 RO RO constant=0b0000000000000000000000000000000
63 ROX ROX CPMS_CL2_PFETSTAT_SRAM_ENABLE_ACTUAL: Actual value of the output feeding the enable signal to the SRAM circuits.

CPMS MMA PFET Header Control Register
Addr: 00000001C008E300 (PPE)
00000001C008E320 (PPE2)
00000001C008E330 (PPE1)
00000000200E8E30 (SCOM)
00000000200E8E32 (SCOM2)
00000000200E8E33 (SCOM1)
Name:PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CPMS_MMA_PFETCNTL
Constant(s):
Comments:PFET control & status register for powering off the local VDD voltage domain (rail).
Note: MMA does not have VCS and also does not have a VDD regulation finger for rVRM.
To workaround potential problems with poweroff, could use OVERRIDE to leave fingers 2:7 enabled as a poor mans retention. This register has the same format as P9.
Note that only bits 0:35 are implemented as a special CCFG type register for manufacturing test.
SelectedAttributes:
LatchesBitsLatch Name [flushval]
0:1PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.MMA_PFETCNTL_REG.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(0:1) [00]
4:5PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.MMA_PFETCNTL_REG.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(2:3) [00]
12:23PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.MMA_PFETCNTL_REG.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(4:15) [000000000000]
42:45PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.MMA_VDD_PFET_SEQ.PG_STATE_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:3) [0000]
46:49PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.MMA_VDD_PFET_SEQ.PG_SELECT_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:3) [0000]
63PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.MMA_PFETCNTL_REG.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(16) [0]
Bit(s)PPEPPE2PPE1SCOMSCOM2SCOM1Dial: Description
0:1 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_MMA_PFETCNTL_VDD_PFET_SEQ_STATE: VDD Domain PFET State using the hardware sequencer.
b00 = No operation
b01 = Transition to Voff
b10 = No operation (reserved)
b11 = Transition to Von
This field is only valid if bits 4:5 = 00 (both vdd_pfet_val_override AND vdd_pfet_sel_override are disabled).
ERRATA requiring Hcode workaround:
CL2 VDD_PFET_REGULATION_FINGER_SET must be:
set after transitioning to Von before checking MMA VDD_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE
cleared before transitioning to Voff.
WRITE_EFFECT{ if ( MMA_FORCE_CL2==0 &&
VDD_PFET_VAL_OVERRIDE==0 && VDD_PFET_SEL_OVERRIDE==0) {
if (VDD_PFET_SEQ_STATE==0b01 &&
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL!=0x00) {
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0x7F &
CL2_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL;
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE=0;
VDD_PG_STATE=1; } else
if (VDD_PFET_SEQ_STATE==0b11 &&
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL!=0xFF) {
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0x01 &
CL2_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL;
if ( CL2_PFETCNTL.VDD_PFET_REGULATION_FINGER_SET && CL2_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL == 0xFF)
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFETS_DISABLED_SENSE=0; else
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFETS_DISABLED_SENSE=1;
VDD_PG_STATE=1;
}}
} AFTER_DELAY[large] {
if (MMA_FORCE_CL2==0 &&
VDD_PFET_VAL_OVERRIDE==0 && VDD_PFET_SEL_OVERRIDE==0) {
if (VDD_PFET_SEQ_STATE==0b01) {
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0x00;
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFETS_DISABLED_SENSE=1;
VDD_PG_STATE=8; } else
if (VDD_PFET_SEQ_STATE==0b11) {
if (CL2_PFETCNTL.VDD_PFET_REGULATION_FINGER_SET && CL2_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL == 0xFF) {
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0xFF;
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE=1; } }
else if (~CL2_PFETCNTL.VDD_PFET_REGULATION_FINGER_SET && CL2_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL == 0xFF)
{
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL=0x7F & CL2_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFET_ENABLE_ACTUAL;
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE=0;
} else
MMA_PFETSTAT.VDD_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE=0;
VDD_PG_STATE=8;
}}} //
2:3 RO RO RO RO RO RO constant=0b00
4 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_MMA_PFETCNTL_VDD_PFET_VAL_OVERRIDE: VDD Domain PFET Value Override

Dial enums:
OVERRIDE_IS_DISABLED=>0b0
OVERRIDE_IS_ENABLED=>0b1
5 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_MMA_PFETCNTL_VDD_PFET_SEL_OVERRIDE: VDD Domain PFET Stage Select Override

Dial enums:
OVERRIDE_IS_DISABLED=>0b0
OVERRIDE_IS_ENABLED=>0b1
6:11 RO RO RO RO RO RO constant=0b000000
Dial enums:
OVERRIDE_IS_DISABLED=>0b0
OVERRIDE_IS_ENABLED=>0b1
12:19 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_MMA_PFETCNTL_VDD_PFET_ENABLE_VALUE: VDD Domain PFET Enable Value
Intended for manual control override usage, a write to this field sets the state of the Core Domain PFET Enables directly.
If vdd_pfet_val_override = 1, a write to this field sets the state of the core PFET Enables until vdd_pfet_val_override is cleared.
20:23 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_MMA_PFETCNTL_VDD_PFET_SEL_VALUE: VDD Domain PFET Select Value
Intended for manual control override usage, a write to this field will index value N into the vdd_power_enable register where N is 0 to 8 if
vdd_pfet_sel_override = 1. If vdd_pfet_sel_override = 0, the field is written but no further action is taken.
0x0: 0b11111111 # On
0x1: 0b01111111
0x2: 0b00111111
0x3: 0b00011111
0x4: 0b00001111
0x5: 0b00000111
0x6: 0b00000011
0x7: 0b00000001
0x8: 0b00000000 # Off
x9:xF - Reserved
DD1 ERRATA requiring workaround when using this field as well.
CL2 VDD_PFET_REGULATION_FINGER_SET must be:
set after transitioning to 0x0 before checking MMA VDD_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE
cleared before transitioning away from 0x0.
24:41 RO RO RO RO RO RO constant=0b000000000000000000
42:45 ROX NCX NCX ROX NCX NCX CPMS_MMA_PFETCNTL_VDD_PG_STATE: For debug, Logic Voltage power gate sequencer FSM (1 hot)
0x8: Idle
0x4: Increment
0x2: Decrement
0x1: Wait
46:49 ROX NCX NCX ROX NCX NCX CPMS_MMA_PFETCNTL_VDD_PG_SEL: For debug, contains the actual index N of the domain VDD PFET select value. See VDD_PFET_SEL_VALUE for encoding of N to power enable value.
50:62 RO RO RO RO RO RO constant=0b0000000000000
63 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_MMA_PFETCNTL_MMA_FORCE_CL2: Used only for workarounds, if separately power gating the MMA domain causes a problem.
0: MMA PFET enable outputs are controlled via this register:
directly if MMA.VDD_PFET_VAL_OVERRIDE=1 or VDD_PFET_SEL_OVERRIDE=1
else this register bitwise ANDd with the CL2 PFET Enable Actual value (note: which also includes an OR with CL2 VDD PFET_REGULATION_FINGER_SET on bit
0)
DD1 ERRATA: the CL2 PFET_REGULATION_FINGER_set was ANDd instead of ORd with bit0 before ANDing with this register.
1: MMA PFET enable outputs are instead controlled by the CL2_PFETCNTL regardless of the other bits in this register.
Note: this is simply a mux control on the eight PFET enable output signals to the MMA. The other latches in this register and the inputs to
MMA_PFETSTAT are unaffected.
NOTE: MMA is typically powered off when CL2 is in retention. Setting this will preclude use of the rVRM on the Core since MMA is not fed by rVRMs.
TODO WRITE_EFFECT here - enforce only switch when the MMA and CL2 PFET values match.

CPMS Core MMA PFET Header Status Register
Addr: 00000001C008E340 (PPE)
00000000200E8E34 (SCOM)
Name:PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CPMS_MMA_PFETSTAT
Constant(s):
Comments:PFET Enable status register.
Note that only bits 0:31 are implemented as a special CCFG type register for manufacturing test.
SelectedAttributes:
LatchesBitsLatch Name [flushval]
0:1PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.ENABLED_SENSE_LAT.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(4:5) [00]
2PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.ENABLED_SENSE_LAT.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(14) [0]
16:23PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.MMA_PFET_ENABLE_REG.CCFG_EFF_Q_INST.FSILAT.LATC.L2(0:7) [00000000]
Bit(s)PPESCOM Dial: Description
0 ROX ROX CPMS_MMA_PFETSTAT_VDD_PFETS_ENABLED_SENSE: PFET Enabled Sense Sample of the Core MMA VDD PFET output summary, providing an AND of all 8 controls as seen at the end of the daisy chain. Provides
continuity check that all PFETs have seen the correct value and have all been enabled.
1 ROX ROX CPMS_MMA_PFETSTAT_VDD_PFETS_DISABLED_SENSE: PFET Disabled Sense Sample of the Core MMA VDD PFET output summary, providing a NOR of all 8 controls as seen at the end of the daisy chain. Provides
continuity check that all PFETs have seen the correct value and have all been disabled.

check only the most important PFET header control representing almost 99% of the width which is sufficient for runtime operation.
3:15 RO RO constant=0b0000000000000

CPMS Core MMA Octagon Register
Addr: 00000001C008E380 (PPE)
00000001C008E3A0 (PPE2)
00000001C008E3B0 (PPE1)
00000000200E8E38 (SCOM)
00000000200E8E3A (SCOM2)
00000000200E8E3B (SCOM1)
Name:PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CPMS_MMAR
Constant(s):
Comments:Register to control the MMA which is the Matrix Multiply Accumulate, a.k.a. Inference Engine, a.k.a. the UFC Octagon. Dana White would be proud.
SelectedAttributes:
LatchesBitsLatch Name [flushval]
0:1PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.MMAR_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:1) [00]
2:3PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.MMAR_MMA_LIMIT_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:1) [00]
4PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.MMAR_MMA_LIMIT_UPDATE_SEL_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
32PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.ANA_CNTL.CXX_TCEQ_MMA_DIRTY_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
Bit(s)PPEPPE2PPE1SCOMSCOM2SCOM1Dial: Description
0 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_MMAR_MMA_AVAILABLE: Indication to the ISU that the MMA is available to process instructions, i.e. it has clocks and power and is not being reset. Drives a signal into
the core.
QME Hcode must clear this bit in preparation for powering off the MMA.
After dropping this signal, Hcode must wait for 2X the round trip time of this signal to the Core ISU then check to ensure MMA_ACTIVE in the QME EISR
has not asserted again, to cover the window case (if so, abort MMA power off routine). Also note that QME Hcode should check SCSR[CORE_QUIESCED]==0
before powering off the MMA dynamically.
Note: this field is only modified if MMA_LIMIT_UPDATE_SELECT is set to 0
WRITE_EFFECT{ } AFTER_DELAY[large] {
MMA_DIRTY = MMA_AVAILABLE; } //
1 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_MMAR_MMA_FUNC_RESET: Resets the state of the functional latches in the MMA without the need for scan flush. Drives a signal into the Core. Note: this bit should be init
to 1 in the initfile due to permanent errata.
Note: this field is only modified if MMA_LIMIT_UPDATE_SELECT is set to 0.
2:3 WO_4P WO_4P NC WO_4P WO_4P NC CPMS_MMAR_MMA_LIMIT: Control MMA throughput by limiting number of ops that can be issued over time. The limit amount for each level is controlled via scanonly latches in
ISU.
00: no additional MMA throughput limit
01: small limit
10: medium limit
11: max limit
This field writes FDIR[MMA_LIMIT] only if MMA_LIMIT_UPDATE_SELECT is set to 1.
4 WO_4P WO_4P NC WO_4P WO_4P NC CPMS_MMAR_MMA_LIMIT_UPDATE_SELECT: Chooses what fields are changed on a write, when this bit is:
0: MMAR[MMA_AVAILABLE & MMA_FUNC_RESET]
1: FDIR[MMA_LIMIT] (and FDIR Pending is also set in CUCR)
are modified, to allow another firmware agent to control MMA thermals independently of other Core Throttle controls.
5:31 RO RO RO RO RO RO constant=0b000000000000000000000000000
32 ROX NCX NCX ROX NCX NCX CPMS_MMAR_MMA_DIRTY: Signal from the Core ISU indicating that the MMA still contains architected state. Informational only.
33:63 RO RO RO RO RO RO constant=0b0000000000000000000000000000000

CPMS Core Update Control Register
Addr: 00000001C008E3C0 (PPE)
00000001C008E3E0 (PPE2)
00000001C008E3F0 (PPE1)
00000000200E8E3C (SCOM)
00000000200E8E3E (SCOM2)
00000000200E8E3F (SCOM1)
Name:PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CPMS_CUCR
Constant(s):
Comments:This register controls when CPMS shadows the Digital Droop & Throttle control (FTC and DPT) and Power Proxy related registers into the Core. It also provides a per-core configurable settings for artificial droop injection via the FDIR.
SelectedAttributes:
LatchesBitsLatch Name [flushval]
0PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CORE_THROTTLE.CUCR_ENABLE_CORE_SHADOW_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
1PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CORE_THROTTLE.CUCR_ENABLE_CORE_SAMPLE_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
2PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CORE_THROTTLE.CUCR_DPT_PER_THREAD_MODE_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
3:4PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CORE_THROTTLE.CUCR_SPARE_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:1) [00]
5PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CORE_THROTTLE.CUCR_CORE_MODE_SAMPLE_DISABLE_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
6PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CORE_THROTTLE.CUCR_STOP01_SAMPLE_ENABLE_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
9PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CORE_THROTTLE.CUCR_REFRESH_FTC_SHADOW_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
10PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CORE_THROTTLE.CUCR_REFRESH_PP_SHADOW_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
11PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CORE_THROTTLE.CUCR_REFRESH_DPT_SETTINGS_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
12:14PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CORE_THROTTLE.CUCR_INDUCED_DROOP_COUNT_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:2) [000]
17:19PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CORE_THROTTLE.CUCR_PCB_SKEW_ADJ_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:2) [000]
31PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CORE_THROTTLE.CUCR_FDCR_UPDATE_INPROGRESS_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
32PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CORE_THROTTLE.CUCR_CORE_SAMPLE_ENABLED_LT_Q_INST.LATC.L2(0) [0]
33:35PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CORE_THROTTLE.CUCR_FTC_SHADOW_STATE_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:2) [000]
36:39PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CORE_THROTTLE.CUCR_FTC_SHADOW_PENDING_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:3) [0000]
40:41PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CORE_THROTTLE.CUCR_PP_SHADOW_STATE_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:1) [00]
42:44PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CORE_THROTTLE.CUCR_PP_SHADOW_PENDING_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:2) [000]
45:46PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CORE_THROTTLE.CUCR_DPT_UPDATE_STATE_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:1) [00]
47:49PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CORE_THROTTLE.CUCR_DPT_UPDATE_PENDING_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:2) [000]
50:52PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CORE_THROTTLE.CUCR_CORE_REFRESH_ACTIVE_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:2) [000]
53:55PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CORE_THROTTLE.CUCR_QME_DATA_XFER_PENDING_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:2) [000]
56:63PCBSLEQ.CPMS0.CORE_THROTTLE.CUCR_QME_EVENTS_PENDING_Q_0_INST.LATC.L2(0:7) [00000000]
Bit(s)PPEPPE2PPE1SCOMSCOM2SCOM1Dial: Description
0 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CUCR_ENABLE_CORE_SHADOW: When set to 1, the CPMS logic will update the "shadow" copies of the throttle & digital droop & Power Proxy configurations into the Core units, when
the corresponding PENDING bits are set below.
When set to 0, register writes cause CPMS to hold the updates to these registers PENDING. On rising edge of this field, CPMS begins shadowing any
"pent up" PENDING DPT, FTC, or PP registers into the core.
QME hcode is responsible for performing the following sequence on Stop Entry before stopping clocks:
WCLR CUCR Enable Core Sample
WOR FDCR[Disable]=1 and FDCR[STICKY_CONTROL]=0b11
Poll until CUCR[FDCR_UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS] = 0
WCLR CUCR Enable Core Shadow
QME hcode is responsible for performing the following sequence on Stop Exit before starting instructions (or running self restore after Core power
on):
WOR CUCR Enable Core Shadow
Poll until CUCR CORE_REFRESH_ACTIVE[0]=0
WCLR FDCR[Disable]
Poll until CUCR[FDCR_UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS]=0
Poll until CUCR CORE_REFRESH_ACTIVE=0b000
DD1 only: ERRATA HW527679
(DD1 workaround) WCLR CUCR Enable Core Shadow
(DD1 workaround) WOR CUCR Enable Core Shadow
(DD1 workaround) Poll CORE_REFRESH_ACTIVE=0b000
WOR CUCR Enable Core Sample
1 RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR RW WO_OR WO_CLEAR CPMS_CUCR_ENABLE_CORE_SAMPLE: When set to 1, the CPMS logic will update its sample data from the core.
When set to 0 the data from the core is suppressed from "polluting" the Sample, Status, Sense, and Data registers in the CPMS with addresses higher
